title: Rajuk conducts eviction drive at Gulshan
body: A mobile court of Rajdhani Unnayan Katripakkha has conducted a drive against illegal traders at Gulshan area in Dhaka and sealed seven residential hotels, restaurants, salons and spas. During the operation, the mobile court also held 14 individuals including nine women and handed them over to police, a Rajuk officer said on Friday. He said that the mobile court led by executive magistrate Md Liton Sarkar along with authorised officer of zone-4/2 of Gulshan, assistant authorised officer, chief building inspector, building inspectors and Gulshan society officials conducted the operation against illegal non-residential and commercial use of residential plots under the zone-4/2 on Thursday. The RAJUK official said that the mobile court sealed seven residential hotels and restaurants and salons and spas and held 14 individuals, including nine women, during the operation. The team sealed Nice Salon located at Plot 7/A, Road 41, Gulshan on charges of operating an illegal spa and salon and held one woman and three men from there and handed them over to the police. Wooden Nice Furniture located at Plot 7/A, Road 41, Gulshan was sealed and closed for operating illegal commercial activities and Hotel Amari located at Plot 47, Road 41, Gulshan was sealed and closed for operating commercial activities, it said. Rajukâ€™s Development Control director Engineer Mohammad Monirul Haque said that the campaign against illegal activities in the residential buildings was an ongoing process of Rajuk. Ratanpur Castle collated at Plot 91/B, Road-24, Gulshan was sealed and closed for operating an illegal spa and salon on the 4th floor of the 6-storey building.
